intro: Lathyrus tenuifolius var. clymenum, commonly known as the slender-leafed vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its trifoliate leaves consist of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes cultivated as a cover crop or for its ornamental value.
